flow.descriptionCdata:
d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.09259aab-dc6a-4b59-90cd-1da9f971c1db.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.0cb5085c-b356-49f5-9cfb-d3755a9ed1d3.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.1d243f98-2881-448c-91a4-82e36acd39ef.prompt=FileName\: d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.215cfb39-b721-427f-bc16-85d0f1e3f81c.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.34b85f94-3d9d-4544-a94a-8f575e145c37.description=
Checks to see if a path is an existing file or folder.

Inputs\:
Source - The full path path to check. This can be either a local path such as c\:\test.txt, or a unc path such as \\testhost\test.txt. This path is relative to the Windows RAS host that the operation is running on.
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for username.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The path does not exist.
success - The operation succeeded.
d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.6860cd2c-16ae-46d4-a785-4ce6898aded9.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.85505dbb-d372-4b2e-ad4c-4b7da16f212b.prompt=${htmlDocument} d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.9c93ef06-1176-4207-b19e-0faa7ba4ec13.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.a36e79a7-ad40-4053-b784-0c679e8b0825.description=
Reads the file specified in the source input parameter.  If Store is true, then all matching lines are pushed into the Session and then subsequent calls to the operation results in the next line being returned.

Inputs\:
source - Path to the file to be read.
filter - Regular expression filter to be applied to each line (can be left blank for all).
store - Whether to store results in the session for retrieval. Valid values \: true,false
delimiter - If set to null, the file is read line by line, otherwise it is a delimiter placed between read lines (note, the entire file may or may not still be fully read at once, depending on size).
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.
eofReset - If set to true than after the No More response has been returned once, the operation will restart reading the file from the beginning on the next call.
characterSet - The character encoding used to read the file (for instance, windows-1252). The default is UTF-8.

Responses\:
more lines - More lines are available to be read in the session.
no more lines - No lines are available for reading in the session.
failure - If something went wrong. 

Results\:
returnResult - One line read from the file. 
COUNT - On the first pass, the total number of lines matched.  On subsequent runs, the number of lines remaining in the session. This result is only returned in line-by-line mode.
d9240097-746b-4cc9-81ae-be4759fc288f.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail
flow.name: Admin Creation Success E-Mail

staticBinding.value: Your Admin Account for ${vm.hostname} has been created successfully.
